au.edu.federation.caliko.visualisation

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.federation.caliko.visualisation.Model

  • public class Model
extends Object
    A class to represent and load a 3D model in WaveFront .OBJ format.

    Vertices, normals, and faces with or without normal indices are supported.

    Models must be stored as triangles, not quads.

    There is no support for textures, texture coordinates, or grouped objects at this time.

    Version:
    0.5 - 07/01/2016
    Author:
    Al Lansley

      • load

        public boolean load(String filename)
        Load a .OBJ model from file.

        By default, no feedback is provided on the model loading. If you wish to see what's going on internally, call Model.enableVerbose() before loading the model - this will display statistics about any vertices/normals/normal indices/faces found in the model, as well as any malformed data.

        If the model file does not contain any vertices then a RuntimeException is thrown. If the file cannot be found then a FileNotFoundException is thrown. If there was a file-system-type error when reading the file then an IOException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the Wavefront .OBJ format model to load, include the path if necessary.
        Returns:
        Whether the file loaded successfully or not. Loading with warnings still counts as a successful load - if necessary enable verbose mode to ensure your model loaded cleanly.

      • printVertices

        public void printVertices()
        Print out the vertices of this model.

      • printNormals

        public void printNormals()
        Print out the vertex normal data for this model.

        Note: This is the contents of the normals list, not the (possibly expanded) normalData array.

      • printFaces

        public void printFaces()
        Print the face data of this model.

        Note: Faces are ONE indexed, not zero indexed.

      • printVertexData

        public void printVertexData()
        Print the vertex data of this model.

        Note: This is the contents of the vertexlData array which is actually used when drawing - and which may be different to the 'vertices' list when using faces (where vertices get re-used).

      • printNormalData

        public void printNormalData()
        Print the normal data of this model.

        Note: This is the contents of the normalData array which is actually used when drawing - and which may be different to the 'normals' list when using faces (where normals get re-used).
